Ben Munat wrote:

<snip />
> I'd really like to write test cases for everything I write, but at this
> point I don't see the use of writing them for the classes I have so far.
> Please set me straight.

This is a philosophy question. How do you /know/ that your class works? 
(I emphasized "know" for a reason.)

Also, if you ever want to change your code in the future, you'll be glad 
you have tests to help you determine whether your changes have 
introduced any defects.
